symbols.name: sap.fe.core.AppComponent
symbols.description:
Main class for components used for an application in SAP Fiori elements.
Application developers using the templates and building blocks provided by SAP Fiori elements should create their apps by extending this component. This ensures that all the necessary services that you need for the building blocks and templates to work properly are started.
When you use sap.fe.core.AppComponent as the base component, you also need to use a rootView. SAP Fiori elements provides two options:
- sap.fe.core.rootView.NavContainer when using sap.m.routing.Router
- sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl when using sap.f.routing.Router (FCL use case)

methods.name: changePageConfiguration

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: The ID of the page for which the configuration is to be changed.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path in the page settings for which the configuration is to be changed.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value of the configuration. This could be a plain value like a string, or a Boolean, or a structured object.

methods.description:
Changes the page configuration of SAP Fiori elements.
This method enables you to change the page configuration of SAP Fiori elements.

methods.name: initializeFeatureToggles

returnValue.description: A promise without any value to allow asynchronous processes

methods.description:
Provides a hook to initialize feature toggles.
This hook is being called by the SAP Fiori elements AppComponent at the time feature toggles can be initialized. To change page configuration, use the sap.fe.core.AppComponent#changePageConfiguration method.

Internal base controller class for SAP Fiori elements application.
If you want to extend a base controller for your custom page, please use for sap.fe.core.PageController.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.ExtensionAPI
symbols.description:
Common Extension API for all pages of SAP Fiori elements for OData V4.
To correctly integrate your app extension coding with SAP Fiori elements, use only the extensionAPI of SAP Fiori elements. Don't access or manipulate controls, properties, models, or other internal objects created by the SAP Fiori elements framework.

properties.name: editFlow
properties.description: A controller extension offering hooks into the edit flow of the application.

properties.name: routing
properties.description: A controller extension offering hooks into the routing flow of the application.

methods.name: addDependent

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Control to be added as a dependent control

methods.description: Add any control as a dependent control to this SAP Fiori elements page.

methods.name: byId

returnValue.description: The requested control, if found in the view / section.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the control without view and section prefix.

methods.description: Access a control by its ID. If you attempt to access an internal control instead of the stable API, the method will raise an error.

methods.name: getEditFlow

returnValue.description: The editFlow controller extension

methods.description: Retrieves the editFlow controller extension for this page.

methods.name: getIntentBasedNavigation

returnValue.description: The intentBasedNavigation controller extension

methods.description: Retrieves the intentBasedNavigation controller extension for this page.

methods.name: getModel

returnValue.description: The required model

parameters.name: sModelName
parameters.description: Name of the model

methods.description:
Get access to models managed by SAP Fiori elements.
The following models can be accessed:

  • undefined: the undefined model returns the SAPUI5 OData V4 model bound to this page
  • i18n / further data models defined in the manifest
  • ui: returns a SAPUI5 JSON model containing UI information. Only the following properties are public and supported:
    • isEditable: set to true if the application is in edit mode
. editMode is deprecated and should not be used anymore. Use isEditable instead.

returnValue.description: The routing controller extension

methods.description: Retrieves the routing controller extension for this page.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.fpm
symbols.description: Collection of classes provided by SAP Fiori elements for the Flexible Programming Model

nodes.name: sap.fe.core.fpm.Component
nodes.description:
Component that can be used as a wrapper component for custom pages.
The component can be used in case you want to use SAP Fiori elements Building Blocks or XML template constructions. You can either extend the component and set the viewName and contextPath within your code or you can use it to wrap your custom XML view directly the manifest when you define your custom page under sapui5/routing/targets:

"myCustomPage": {
 "type": "Component",
 "id": "myCustomPage",
 "name": "sap.fe.core.fpm",
 "title": "My Custom Page",
 "options": {
	"settings": {
		"viewName": "myNamespace.myView",
		"contextPath": "/MyEntitySet"
	}
 }
 }

methods.name: cancelDocument

returnValue.description: Promise resolves once editable document has been discarded

parameters.name: oContext
parameters.description: Context of the editable document

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description: Can contain the following attributes:

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: This is the control used to open the discard popover

parameters.name: skipDiscardPopover
parameters.description: Optional, supresses the discard popover and allows custom handling

methods.description: Discard the editable document.

methods.name: createDocument

returnValue.description: Promise resolves once the object has been created

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: ODataListBinding object or the binding path or a table building block for a temporary list binding

parameters.name: mInParameters
parameters.description: Contains the following attributes:

parameters.name: createAtEnd
parameters.description: Specifies if the new entry should be created at the top or bottom of a table in case of creationMode 'Inline'

parameters.name: creationDialogFields
parameters.description:
Defines the list of properties that are displayed in the creation dialog when the creation mode is set to 'CreationDialog'.
The value is a comma-separated list of property names

parameters.name: creationMode
parameters.description:
The creation mode using one of the following:
NewPage - the created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether metadata 'Sync', 'Async', or 'Deferred' is used
Inline - The creation is done inline (in a table)
External - The creation is done in a different application specified by the parameter 'outbound'
CreationDialog - the creation is done in the table, with a dialog allowing to specify some initial property values (the properties are listed in `creationDialogFields`)

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The initial data for the created document

parameters.name: outbound
parameters.description: The navigation target where the document is created in case of creationMode 'External'

parameters.name: selectedContexts
parameters.description: The contexts that are selected in the table initiating the creation. Used in case of a TreeTable to determine the parent context of the created document

parameters.name: singleDraftForCreate
parameters.description: When enabled, an extra request checks if any drafts exist that were never saved. If unsaved drafts are found, the newest one is opened. If no unsaved drafts are found, a new entity is created

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: ID of the table

methods.description: Creates a new document.

methods.name: customMassEditSave

returnValue.description: `true` to prevent the default execution, `false` to keep the standard behavior

parameters.name: _mParameters
parameters.description: Object containing the parameters passed to customMassEditSave

parameters.name: aContexts
parameters.description: Array containing the selected contexts for the mass edit

parameters.name: oUpdateData
parameters.description: A dictionary containing the propertyPath and its value

methods.description:
This function can be used to execute code on the mass edit save. You can execute custom coding in this function. If you decide to do your own save processing, you can return `true` to prevent the default save behavior.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.Instead.

methods.name: invokeAction

returnValue.description: A promise which resolves once the action has been executed, providing the response

parameters.name: sActionName
parameters.description: The name of the action to be called

parameters.name: mInParameters
parameters.description: Contains the following attributes:

parameters.name: contexts
parameters.description: For a bound action, a context or an array with contexts for which the action is to be called must be provided

parameters.name: invocationGrouping
parameters.description: Mode how actions are to be called: 'ChangeSet' to put all action calls into one changeset, 'Isolated' to put them into separate changesets

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: A human-readable label for the action. This is needed in case the action has a parameter and a parameter dialog is shown to the user. The label will be used for the title of the dialog and for the confirmation button

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: For an unbound action, an instance of an OData V4 model must be provided

parameters.name: parameterValues
parameters.description: A map of action parameter names and provided values

parameters.name: requiresNavigation
parameters.description: Boolean value indicating whether navigation is required after the action has been executed. Navigation takes place to the context returned by the action

parameters.name: skipParameterDialog
parameters.description: Skips the action parameter dialog if values are provided for all of them in parameterValues

methods.description: Invokes an action (bound or unbound) and tracks the changes so that other pages can be refreshed and show the updated data upon navigation.

methods.name: onBeforeCreate

returnValue.description: A promise to be returned by the overridden method. If resolved, the 'Create' action is triggered. If rejected, the 'Create' action is not triggered.

parameters.name: _mParameters
parameters.description: Object containing the parameters passed to onBeforeCreate

parameters.name: contextPath
parameters.description: Path pointing to the context on which Create action is triggered

parameters.name: createParameters
parameters.description: Array of values that are filled in the Action Parameter Dialog

methods.description:
This function can be used to intercept the 'Create' action. You can execute custom coding in this function. The framework waits for the returned promise to be resolved before continuing the 'Create' action. If you reject the promise, the 'Create' action is stopped.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.description:
This function can be used to intercept the 'Delete' action. You can execute custom coding in this function. The framework waits for the returned promise to be resolved before continuing the 'Delete' action. If you reject the promise, the 'Delete' action is stopped.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: onBeforeDiscard

returnValue.description: A promise to be returned by the overridden method. If resolved, the 'Discard' action is triggered. If rejected, the 'Discard' action is not triggered and the user stays in edit mode.

methods.description:
This function can be used to intercept the 'Discard' action. You can execute custom coding in this function. The framework waits for the returned promise to be resolved before continuing the 'Discard' action. If you reject the promise, the 'Discard' action is stopped and the user stays in edit mode.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

returnValue.description: A promise that is rejected if the execution is prohibited and resolved by the promise returned by the fnFunction.

parameters.description: The function to be executed. Should return a promise that is settled after completion of the execution. If nothing is returned, immediate completion is assumed.

parameters.description: Triggers a busy indicator when the function is executed.

parameters.description: This operation updates the current document without using the bound model and context. As a result, the draft status is updated if a draft document exists, and the user has to confirm the cancellation of the editing process.

Additionally, the outbound definition can be used to provide parameters for intent-based navigation. See :be0cf40f61184b358b5faedaec98b2da Descriptor for Applications, Components, and Libraries for more information.

parameters.name: mNavigationParameters

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.MessageHandler
symbols.description: A controller extension offering message handling.

methods.name: showMessageDialog

returnValue.description: A promise that is resolved once the user closes the dialog. If there are no messages to be shown, the promise is resolved immediately

methods.description: Shows a message dialog with transition messages if there are any. The message dialog is shown as a modal dialog. Once the user confirms the dialog, all transition messages are removed from the message model. If there is more than one message, a list of messages is shown. The user can filter on message types and can display details as well as the long text. If there is one message, the dialog immediately shows the details of the message. If there is just one success message, a message toast is shown instead.

This function is used to intercept the routing event after binding a page.
If it is declared as an extension, it allows you to intercept and change the normal flow of binding.
This function is not called directly, but overridden separately by consuming controllers. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

This function is used to intercept the routing event before binding a page.
If it is declared as an extension, it allows you to intercept and change the normal flow of binding.
This function is not called directly, but overridden separately by consuming controllers. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

returnValue.description: `true` to prevent the default execution, false to keep the standard behavior

parameters.name: mNavigationParameters
parameters.description: Object containing row context and page context

parameters.name: bindingContext
parameters.description: The currently selected context

methods.description:
This function can be used to intercept the routing event happening during the normal process of navigating from one page to another (like clicking on the table row to navigate, or when pagination buttons are clicked).
The function is NOT called during other means of external outbound navigation (like a navigation configured via a link, or by using navigation buttons).
If declared as an extension, it allows you to intercept and change the normal navigation flow. If you decide to do your own navigation processing, you can return `true` to prevent the default routing behavior.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.Routing

parameters.description: Title that will be used as "email subject" in 'Send Email'. This takes precedence over oShareMetadata.title.

parameters.name: url

parameters.description: SAP Jam-specific metadata.

parameters.description: Title that will be used as 'share text' in 'Share in SAP Jam'. This takes precedence over oShareMetadata.title.

parameters.description: URL that will be used specifically for 'Share in SAP Jam'. This takes precedence over oShareMetadata.url.

parameters.name: title

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL that will be used specifically for 'Save as Tile'. This takes precedence over oShareMetadata.url.

parameters.description: Default title that will be used as 'email subject' in 'Send Email', 'share text' in 'Share in SAP Jam' and 'title' in 'Save as Tile'

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Default URL that will be used via 'Send Email', 'Share in SAP Jam', and 'Save as Tile'

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.controllerextensions.ViewState
symbols.description:
A controller extension offering hooks for state handling
If you need to maintain a specific state for your application, you can use the controller extension.

methods.name: adaptBindingRefreshControls

parameters.name: aCollectedControls
parameters.description: The collected controls

methods.description:
This function should add all controls relevant for refreshing to the provided control array.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: adaptBindingRefreshHandler

parameters.name: _oControl
parameters.description: The control for which the refresh handler is adapted.

parameters.name: _oControlHandler
parameters.description: A plain object which can have one function: refreshBinding

methods.description:
Customize the refreshBinding function for a certain control.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: adaptControlStateHandler

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control to get state handler for

parameters.name: aControlHandler
parameters.description: A list of plain objects with two functions: retrieve and apply

methods.description:
Customize the retrieve and apply functions for a certain control.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: adaptStateControls

parameters.name: _aCollectedControls
parameters.description: The collected controls

methods.description:
This function should add all controls for given view that should be considered for the state handling to the provided control array.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: applyAdditionalStates

parameters.name: oViewState
parameters.description: The current view state

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: Extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Applying additional, not control related, states - is called only if navigation type is iAppState.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: applyInitialStateOnly

returnValue.description: If true, only the initial view state is applied once, else any new view state is also applied on follow-up calls (default)

methods.description:
Defines whether the view state should only be applied once initially.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.Instead.
Important: You should only override this method for custom pages and not for the standard ListReportPage and ObjectPage!

methods.name: applyNavigationParameters

parameters.name: oNavParameter
parameters.description: The current navigation parameter

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: Extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Apply navigation parameters is not called if the navigation type is iAppState
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: applyViewState

returnValue.description: Promise for async state handling

parameters.name: oViewState
parameters.description: The view state to apply (can be undefined)

parameters.name: oNavParameter
parameters.description: The current navigation parameter

parameters.name: skipMerge
parameters.description: Boolean which determines to skip the key user shine through

methods.description: Applies the given view state to this extensions view.

methods.name: onAfterStateApplied

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: Extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

methods.description:
Hook to react when state for given view was applied.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: onBeforeStateApplied

parameters.name: aPromises
parameters.description: Extensible array of promises to be resolved before continuing

parameters.name: navigationType
parameters.description: Navigation type responsible for the applying the state

methods.description:
Hook to react before a state for given view is applied.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: onRestore
methods.description: Called when the application is restored due to keep-alive mode.

methods.name: onSuspend
methods.description: Called when the application is suspended due to keep-alive mode.

methods.name: retrieveAdditionalStates

parameters.name: mAdditionalStates
parameters.description: The additional state

methods.description:
Extend the map of additional states (not control bound) to be added to the current view state of the given view.
This function is meant to be individually overridden by consuming controllers, but not to be called directly. The override execution is: sap.ui.core.mvc.OverrideExecution.After.

methods.name: retrieveViewState

returnValue.description: A promise resolving the view state

methods.description: Retrieve the view state of this extensions view. When this function is called more than once before finishing, all but the final response will resolve to undefined.

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.fpm.Component
symbols.description:
Component that can be used as a wrapper component for custom pages.
The component can be used in case you want to use SAP Fiori elements Building Blocks or XML template constructions. You can either extend the component and set the viewName and contextPath within your code or you can use it to wrap your custom XML view directly the manifest when you define your custom page under sapui5/routing/targets:

"myCustomPage": {
 "type": "Component",
 "id": "myCustomPage",
 "name": "sap.fe.core.fpm",
 "title": "My Custom Page",
 "options": {
	"settings": {
		"viewName": "myNamespace.myView",
		"contextPath": "/MyEntitySet"
	}
 }
 }

properties.name: viewName
properties.description: Name of the XML view which is used for this page. The XML view can contain SAP Fiori elements Building Blocks and XML template constructions.

methods.name: getAppComponent

returnValue.description: The current AppComponent

methods.description: Returns the current AppComponent.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.fpm.Component

symbols.name: sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl
symbols.description:
Base controller class for your own root view with an sap.f.FlexibleColumnLayout control.
By using or extending this controller, you can use your own root view with the sap.fe.core.AppComponent and you can make use of SAP Fiori elements pages and SAP Fiori elements building blocks.
symbols.title: class sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl

symbols.description:
Base controller class for your own root view with a sap.m.NavContainer control.
By using or extending this controller you can use your own root view with the sap.fe.core.AppComponent and you can make use of SAP Fiori elements pages and SAP Fiori elements building blocks.
